text: It's off by default because it's not really needed for stable versions and takes like 1-2s in each build, which adds up over time

elements.text: It's off by default because it's not really needed for stable versions and takes like 1-2s in each build, which adds up over time

text: `--compile=min -O0` halves the time on my machine

elements.text: halves the time on my machine

text: So based on a quick test build, it reduces the time by about 1s to ~0.8-0.9s. That's still 10% of the total time setup-julia takes. For a standard LTS + Latest + Nightly build across OSes that would be ~15s per push/PR already, or ~45 billed seconds on paid runners.

elements.text: So based on a quick test build, it reduces the time by about 1s to ~0.8-0.9s. That's still 10% of the total time setup-julia takes. For a standard LTS + Latest + Nightly build across OSes that would be ~15s per push/PR already, or ~45 billed seconds on paid runners.

text: so I'm not sure it's worth it to run as default

elements.text: so I'm not sure it's worth it to run as default

text: But I'll definitely change the command that's run when setting `show-versioninfo` to use those flags, thanks! :slightly_smiling_face:
